name: Avoid having Methods and Functions without a  naming convention (PHP)
description:
This rule searches for all the Functions and Methods that do not respect the naming convention.
Follow the name convention that should be accepted.
If the name contains UpperCase + "_"  So No Violation is reported
If the name contains UpperCase +  No "_"   So The Violation is reported
If the name contains No UpperCase + "_"   So The Violation is reported
If the name contains No UpperCase + No "_"   So No Violation is reported
output:
"This report lists all the Functions and Methods that do not respect the naming convention.

This QR provides the following information:
Function or Method full name."
rationale: Using a naming convention makes the source code easier to read and therefore to maintain.
remediation: Modify the source code to reduce the number of Functions and Methods that do not respect the naming convention.
